name: Eye Color Quad - Cherry Collection
ingredients: Mica, Cetearyl Ethylhexanoate, C12-20 Acid Peg-8 Ester, Hdi/Trimethylol Hexyllactone Crosspolymer, Squalane, Glycerin, Chondrus Crispus Extract, Ethylhexylglycerin, Dicalcium Phosphate, Polysorbate 80, 1, 2-Hexanediol, Silica, Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Caprylyl Glycol,  [+/- Titanium Dioxide (Ci 77891), Iron Oxides (Ci 77491), Iron Oxides (Ci 77492), Iron Oxides (Ci 77499), Aluminum Powder (Ci 77000), Bismuth Oxychloride (Ci 77163), Blue 1 Lake (Ci 42090), Bronze Powder (Ci 77400), Carmine (Ci 75470), Chromium Hydroxide Green (Ci 77289), Chromium Oxide Greens (Ci 77288), Copper Powder (Ci 77400), Ferric Ammonium Ferrocyanide (Ci 77510), Ferric Ferrocyanide (Ci 77510), Manganese Violet (Ci 77742), Ultramarines (Ci 77007), Yellow 5 Lake (Ci 19140)]...Please be aware that ingredient lists may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product package you receive for the most up to date list of ingredients.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Use the applicator to apply onto eyes for desired effect..Pro tip:.-Select TOM FORD shades can be worn both wet and dry. Just look for the TOM FORD logo imprinted on the powder formula to know if your favorite quad can be applied wet for a bold effect or dry for a soft, sheer finish.

shades.shade_descriptor: midtone copper red, shimmering burnt red with deep red and maroon

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was excited to get this cherry quad eyeshadow palette. I used the dark purple color as an eyeliner on my lower lashes. big mistake as I developed an allergy!  Laura Mercier caviar eyeshadow is better!
